questionText: All colleges will ask for a personal essay.

possibleAnswers.txt: true
false

questionText: What is the word limit for CommonApp essays?
For CommonApp, students will be asked to choose to respond to _____ out of _____ 5 prompts.
For CommonApp, students should aim to reach _____ of the word limit or use full range.
Students shouldn’t talk about failure in their personal essays.

possibleAnswers.txt: True. Admissions committees want to hear the good parts of a student’s life.
False. Admission committee want to see growth

questionText: In most cases, which isn’t a writing section listed on an application?

possibleAnswers.txt: fictional essay
short response
supplemental essay
disciplinary history
optional information

questionText: The essay prompt asks the student to write about a setback. What is the admissions committee looking for?

possibleAnswers.txt: essay about family’s setback
essay about a peer’s setback and what they learned from the experience
essay about the student’s setback and what they learned from the experience
essay about student’s setback

questionText: A student writes a great essay but it’s 500 words over the word limit. What should the student do?

possibleAnswers.txt: Leave the essay as is. If the essay is that great, the admissions committee won’t care.
Leave the essay as is. The student can always be the exception to the rule.
Condense the original essay but still main their original points. The admissions committee will see the student follows directions.
Write a new essay from scratch. The student can always be the exception to the rule.

questionText: What’s a helpful tip to write a strong essay but stay within the word limit?

possibleAnswers.txt: Don’t go into detail.
Write in active voice. Avoid writing in passive voice or voice of beings.
Use I-Statements in every sentence.
Ask a peer to write the essay.

questionText: When writing about disciplinary history, what isn’t a good reason for students for students to ask their guidance counselor for help?

possibleAnswers.txt: The guidance counselor knows what the high school reports to colleges, so the student knows what to share
The guidance counselor is expected to support the student and talk about how good they are.
The guidance counselor can write a letter of recommendation to discuss how the student’s grown from the experience
If the student takes responsibility and is proactive about the process, they can earn the guidance counselor’s trust.

questionText: What shouldn’t the student do when writing about disciplinary history?

possibleAnswers.txt: Overshare. Write about every detail.
Be honest.
Take responsibility.
Use guidance counselor for help.

questionText: If a student has a record of disciplinary history, the school will never consider the student.

possibleAnswers.txt: True. The school wants the perfect student.
True. The damage has been done and the student can’t change.
False. Some infractions will be deemed more seriously than others, especially if the student demonstrates growth.
False. As long as the student has perfect grades, the school won’t reject a student over their disciplinary history

questionText: What shouldn’t students write about in the optional essay?

possibleAnswers.txt: Gap in timeline/educational history
a failed course
family demands that impacted the student’s ability to perform well or be involved
additional achievements

questionText: Students should always submit their first draft.

possibleAnswers.txt: True. The student doesn’t need someone to proofread because they have spellcheck.
True. The first draft is the perfect draft. No need to overthink.
False. Each draft needs to be proofread or read out loud.
False. The student should submit the 63rd draft.

questionText: For supplemental essays, students do not receive the topic ahead of time so it can be challenging to prepare for this essay in advance. What tip shouldn’t students follow?

possibleAnswers.txt: Procrastinate.
Create a 'bank' of influential people or events to speed up the process.
Write a list about unique resources or attributes about the school.
Write a list about personal characters that will help the student stand out from other applicants.
